business rule.name: Business rule task type
business rule.description: Business rules, added with BPMN 2.0, are specific types of services maintained by a business group, rather than an IT group. The rule shape is used to represent the implementation of a business rule.

manual task.name: Manual task type
manual task.description: A manual task type is used whenever an activity must be executed manually. It can be executed without any outside help or application (e.g. loading a truck with product).

receive task.name: Receive task type
receive task.description: A receive task indicates that the process is relying on an incoming message from a third party. Upon receiving a message, the task has been performed.

script task.name: Script task type
script task.description: Script tasks are executed by a business process engine. The script is written in a language that the engine can parse, which, in many instances, is JavaScript.

send task.name: Send task type
send task.description: A send task sends a message to another process or lane. The task is completed once the message is sent.

service task.name: Service task type
service task.description: A service task is any task that uses an automated application or web service to complete the task.

user task.name: User task type
user task.description: The user task type indicates that the task is being performed by a person and cannot be easily broken down into simpler tasks.

timer event.name: Timer event type
timer event.description: A Timer event occurs based on a predefined time or after a specific duration has passed. It can be used to schedule activities or trigger process transitions at specified times.

conditional event.name: Conditional event type
conditional event.description: A Conditional event is triggered when a predefined condition is met or when a particular data condition is satisfied. It allows for decision-making within a process based on specific criteria.

link event.name: Link event type
link event.description: A Link event is used to connect different parts of a process that are in separate process diagrams. It enables the synchronization or communication between processes.

signal event.name: Signal event type
signal event.description: A Signal event represents the receipt or emission of a signal, which can be used to initiate or terminate activities within a process. It provides a mechanism for inter-process communication.

error event.name: Error event type
error event.description: An Error event indicates the occurrence of an unexpected error during the execution of a process. It can be used to handle and manage errors, triggering appropriate error-handling activities or processes.

escalation event.name: Escalation event type
escalation event.description: An Escalation event represents the escalation of a situation or an issue within a process to a higher level of authority or management. It enables the handling of exceptional or critical scenarios.

termination event.name: Termination event type
termination event.description: A Termination event signifies the premature termination of a process or a part of it. It indicates the abrupt completion of the process without further execution of subsequent activities.

compensation event.name: Compensation event type
compensation event.description: A Compensation event is used to handle the compensation or reversal of activities that were previously performed within a process. It allows for the correction of errors or the undoing of specific actions.

cancel event.name: Cancel event type
cancel event.description: A Cancel event is used to cancel or terminate an ongoing activity within a process. It can be triggered by external factors or conditions.

multiple event.name: Multiple event type
multiple event.description: A Multiple event represents multiple triggers or occurrences happening simultaneously within a process. It allows for the parallel initiation of multiple activities or processes.

multiple parallel event.name: Multiple Parallel event type
multiple parallel event.description: A Multiple Parallel event is similar to the Multiple event, but it specifically signifies the simultaneous and parallel occurrence of multiple events or triggers within a process.
